title: do pes graduates get into ivy leagues for masters?

comments.body:
I know some folks at Columbia, Cornell, and UPenn. 

It really depends on what you're interested in doing - the Ivy league is just a collection of private schools in the northeast that have low undergrad acceptance rates and play in the same football league. Depending on your area of interest, they may not even be super highly ranked for your field of study.

Ivy League colleges aren't popular for Engineering. It's easier to get into them than other colleges.

The top rates colleges for Engineering in the US are: MIT, Stanford, UC Berkeley, University of Michigan, Purdue, USC, etc. They're better than any of the Ivy League schools.
